verses.text_plain: I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication.
verses.verse_html:
1I cried unto the Lord with my voice; with my voice unto the Lord did I make my supplication. ▼
▼ Maschil…: or, A Psalm of David, giving instruction

tokens.definition: זָעַק zâʻaq, zaw-ak'; a primitive root; to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly:—assemble, call (together), (make a) cry (out), come with such a company, gather (together), cause to be proclaimed.

verses.text_plain: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.
verses.verse_html: 2I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.

tokens.definition: שָׁפַךְ shâphak, shaw-fak'; a primitive root; to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out:—cast (up), gush out, pour (out), shed(-der, out), slip.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: pour out (46x), shed (36x), pour (20x), cast (6x), gush out (1x), miscellaneous (6x).

verses.text_plain: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.
verses.verse_html: 3When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

tokens.definition: רוּחַ rûwach, roo'-akh; from H7306 ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions):—air, anger, blast, breath, × cool, courage, mind, × quarter, × side, spirit(-ual), tempest, × vain, (whirl-) wind(-y).

verses.text_plain: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
verses.verse_html:
4I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul. ▼
▼ I looked…: or, Look on the right hand, and see
 , ▼
▼ failed…: Heb. perished from me
 , ▼
▼ cared…: Heb. sought after

tokens.definition: גָּמַל gâmal, gaw-mal'; a primitive root; to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean:—bestow on, deal bountifully, do (good), recompense, requite, reward, ripen, serve, mean, yield.
tokens.kjv_translation_count: wean (10x), reward (8x), dealt bountifully (4x), do (4x), bestowed (2x), recompense (2x), weaned child (2x), do good (1x), requite (1x), ripening (1x), served (1x), yielded (1x).
